alert.note: Alert for Northern Aitkin; South Aitkin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 20 at 2:59PM CST until February 23 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM MONDAY TO 12 AM WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 9 to 15 inches. * WHERE...Northern Aitkin and South Aitkin Counties. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Mille Lacs Band, East Lake and, Big Sandy Lake areas. * WHEN...From 3 AM Monday to 12 AM Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest accumulations will be Monday during the first wave of the system; however, a secondary wave will arrive Tuesday and mainly impact areas south and east of the Iron Range. The snow should be dry and fluffy.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.
